docs.snippet: Delia Fischer, a FIFA spokeswoman, announced that Luis Suárez, Uruguay’s striker, will be banned for nine matches after being found guilty of biting the Italy defender Giorgio Chiellini.
docs.lead_paragraph: Delia Fischer, a FIFA spokeswoman, announced that Luis Suárez, Uruguay’s striker, will be banned for nine matches after being found guilty of biting the Italy defender Giorgio Chiellini.

docs.snippet: Uruguay president Jose Mujica will hold a meeting later on Thursday to discuss "options" after a record nine-match ban imposed by FIFA on striker Luis Suarez, local media reported.
docs.lead_paragraph: Uruguay president Jose Mujica will hold a meeting later on Thursday to discuss "options" after a record nine-match ban imposed by FIFA on striker Luis Suarez, local media reported.

headline.main: Upset Uruguayan Government to Meet Over Suarez Ban
headline.print_headline: Upset Uruguayan Government to Meet Over Suarez Ban

docs.snippet: Brazil great Ronaldo believes Luis Suarez biting an opponent was terrible for football at a World Cup of "wonderful surprises."
docs.lead_paragraph: Brazil great Ronaldo believes Luis Suarez biting an opponent was terrible for football at a World Cup of "wonderful surprises."

headline.main: Ronaldo: Suarez Bite Blight on Wonderful World Cup
headline.print_headline: Ronaldo: Suarez Bite Blight on Wonderful World Cup

docs.snippet: European referees will handle two all-South American matches on Saturday as the knockout stage gets underway at the World Cup.
docs.lead_paragraph: European referees will handle two all-South American matches on Saturday as the knockout stage gets underway at the World Cup.

headline.main: Webb, Kuipers to Referee All-South America Clashes
headline.print_headline: Webb, Kuipers to Referee All-South America Clashes

docs.snippet: Spain, Italy, England – all gone home. With the U.S. team reaching the next stage of competition, some predictions are due.
docs.abstract: Spain, Italy, England – all gone home. With the U.S. team reaching the next stage of competition, some predictions are due.

headline.main: A Shift in the Beautiful Game

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: United States Men's National Soccer Team

docs.snippet: Several hundred Uruguayans gathered at a Montevideo airfield Thursday night waiting on the expected return of soccer player Luis Suarez after his banning from the World Cup for biting an Italian player.
docs.lead_paragraph: Several hundred Uruguayans gathered at a Montevideo airfield Thursday night waiting on the expected return of soccer player Luis Suarez after his banning from the World Cup for biting an Italian player.

headline.main: Uruguayan Fans Wait Fruitlessly for Banned Suarez
headline.print_headline: Uruguayan Fans Wait Fruitlessly for Banned Suarez

docs.snippet: As Luis Suarez prepared to leave the World Cup in disgrace, Americans and Algerians were celebrating their places in the knockout rounds on a dramatic final day of the group stage on Thursday.
docs.lead_paragraph: As Luis Suarez prepared to leave the World Cup in disgrace, Americans and Algerians were celebrating their places in the knockout rounds on a dramatic final day of the group stage on Thursday.

headline.main: US and Algeria in, Suarez Out of World Cup
headline.print_headline: US and Algeria in, Suarez Out of World Cup

docs.snippet: The annual study said more land than ever was devoted to growing poppies, and noted a rise in the use of methamphetamines and marijuana in the United States.
docs.lead_paragraph: The annual study said more land than ever was devoted to growing poppies, and noted a rise in the use of methamphetamines and marijuana in the United States.
docs.abstract: United Nations' Annual World Drug Report says illegal opium cultivation occupies more land worldwide than ever before, largely because of a surge in Afghanistan, world's dominant opium producer; also notes a rise in use of methamphetamines and marijuana in the United States.

headline.main: Opium Production on the Rise Worldwide, U.N. Reports

docs.snippet: Luis Suárez, who was suspended twice before for biting opponents, will miss the rest of the World Cup and the start of the English Premier League season.
docs.lead_paragraph: Luis Suárez, who was suspended twice before for biting opponents, will miss the rest of the World Cup and the start of the English Premier League season.
docs.abstract: Luis Suarez, enigmatic striker from Uruguay who has starred for Liverpool in England’s Premier League, is suspended for nine games and barred from all soccer-related activities for four months; FIFA’s disciplinary committee determined that he bit an opponent during Uruguay’s 1-0 World Cup victory over Italy.

headline.seo: World Cup 2014: Luis Suárez Suspended by FIFA for Latest Bite
headline.main: Uruguay Star Barred 9 Games and 4 Months in Biting Incident
headline.print_headline: Suárez Suspended for 4 Months for Biting

docs.snippet: Also this week, a military judge overseeing a war-crimes tribunal issued an order that generated new dispute over how much classified information the C.I.A. must give defense lawyers.
docs.lead_paragraph: Also this week, a military judge overseeing a war-crimes tribunal issued an order that generated new dispute over how much classified information the C.I.A. must give defense lawyers.
docs.abstract: Lawyers for six low-level detainees at Guantanamo Bay, Cuba, whom Uruguay has offered to resettle send letter to Obama administration urging it to act on deal; also, military judge overseeing a war-crimes tribunal issues order that generates new dispute over how much classified information Central Intelligence Agency must give defense lawyers.

headline.main: Guantánamo Detainees’ Lawyers Urge Obama to Approve Release to Uruguay
headline.print_headline: Guantánamo Detainees’ Lawyers Urge Obama to Approve Release to Uruguay
